tags.name: CheckResults
tags.description: Returns the complete results of executed checks on tables and columns.

tags.name: CheckResultsOverview
tags.description: Returns the overview of the recently executed checks on tables and columns.

tags.name: Checks
tags.description: Data quality check definition management

tags.name: Columns
tags.description: Manages columns inside a table

tags.name: Connections
tags.description: Manages connections to monitored data sources

tags.name: Dashboards
tags.description: Provides access to data quality dashboards

tags.name: DataGroupingConfigurations
tags.description: Manages data grouping configurations on a table

tags.name: DataSources
tags.description: Rest API controller that operates on data sources that are not yet imported, testing connections or retrieving the metadata (schemas and tables).

tags.name: Defaults
tags.description: Default settings management for configuring the default data quality checks that are configured for all imported tables and columns.

tags.name: Environment
tags.description: DQOps environment and configuration controller, provides access to the DQOps configuration, current user's information and issue local API Keys for the calling user.

tags.name: Errors
tags.description: Returns the errors related to check executions on tables and columns.

tags.name: Healthcheck
tags.description: Health check service for checking if the DQOps service is up and operational.

tags.name: Incidents
tags.description: Data quality incidents controller that supports loading incidents and changing the status of an incident.

tags.name: Jobs
tags.description: Jobs management controller that supports starting new jobs, such as running selected data quality checks

tags.name: LogShipping
tags.description: Log shipping controller that accepts logs sent from a web application or external tools and aggregates them in the local DQOps instance logs.

tags.name: Rules
tags.description: Rule management

tags.name: Schemas
tags.description: Schema management

tags.name: SensorReadouts
tags.description: Returns the complete sensor readouts of executed checks on tables and columns.

tags.name: Sensors
tags.description: Sensors definition management

tags.name: SharedCredentials
tags.description: Shared credentials management for managing credentials that are stored in the shared .credentials folder in the DQOps user's home folder.

tags.name: TableComparisonResults
tags.description: Controller that returns the results of the most recent table comparison that was performed between the compared table and the reference table (the source of truth).

tags.name: TableComparisons
tags.description: Manages the configuration of table comparisons between tables on the same or different data sources

tags.name: Tables
tags.description: Manages tables inside a connection/schema

tags.name: Timezones
tags.description: Timezone management

tags.name: Users
tags.description: User management service

get.description: Returns a flat list of all checks available in DQOps, both built-in checks and user defined or customized checks.
Returns a check definition

post.description: Creates (adds) a new custom check that is a pair of a sensor name and a rule name.

201.description: New custom check successfully created

409.description: Custom check with the same name already exists

put.description: Updates an existing check, making a custom check definition if it is not present

204.description: Custom check successfully updated

409.description: Cannot change a check definition of a built-in check

get.description: Returns a list of connections (data sources)
Return the full details of a connection given the connection name

post.description: Creates a new connection

201.description: New connection successfully created

409.description: Connection with the same name already exists

put.description: Updates an existing connection

204.description: Connection successfully updated

get.description: Return the basic details of a connection given the connection name

post.description: Creates a new connection given the basic information.

201.description: New connection successfully created

409.description: Connection with the same name already exists

put.description: Updates the basic information of a connection

204.description: Connection's basic parameters successfully updated

put.description: Disables a named check on this connection in the locations specified by filter

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Check search filters and table/column selectors.

204.description: Checks disabled

put.description: Enables a named check on this connection in the locations specified by filter

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Check search filters and rules configuration

204.description: Checks enabled in bulk

get.description: Return the comments for a connection

put.description: Updates (replaces) the list of comments of a connection

204.description: Connection's comments successfully updated

get.description: Finds common column names that are used on one or more tables. The list of columns is sorted in descending order by column name.

200.description: List of common columns within a connection returned

get.description: Return the default data grouping configuration for a connection

200.description: Connection's default data grouping configuration returned

put.description: Updates the default data grouping connection of a connection

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Default data grouping configuration to be assigned to a connection

204.description: Connection's default data grouping configuration successfully updated

get.description: Retrieves the configuration of data quality incident grouping and incident notifications

put.description: Updates (replaces) configuration of incident grouping and notifications on a connection (data source) level.

204.description: Connection's incident configuration successfully updated

get.description: Return the labels for a connection

put.description: Updates the list of labels of a connection

204.description: Connection's labels successfully updated

get.description: Return the schedule for a connection for a scheduling group

put.description: Updates the schedule of a connection for a scheduling group (named schedule for checks with a similar time series configuration)

204.description: Connection's schedule successfully updated

parameters.name: body

get.description: Returns a list of columns inside a table
Returns a list of columns inside a table with the metrics captured by the most recent statistics collection.
Returns the full column specification

404.description: Connection, table or column not found

post.description: Creates a new column (adds a column metadata to the table)

201.description: New column successfully created

409.description: Column with the same name already exists

put.description: Updates an existing column specification, changing all the fields (even the column level data quality checks).

204.description: Column successfully updated

delete.description: Deletes a column from the table

get.description: Returns the column specification

404.description: Connection, table or column not found

put.description: Updates an existing column, changing only the basic information like the expected data type (the data type snapshot).

204.description: Column basic information successfully updated

404.description: Connection, table or column not found

put.description: Updates the list of comments assigned to a column.

parameters.description: List of comments to stored (replaced) on the column or an empty object to clear the list of assigned comments on the column

get.description: Returns a list of the profiler (statistics) metrics on a chosen table captured during the most recent statistics collection.

Read the most recent results of executed data quality checks on the table and return the current table's data quality status - the number of failed data quality checks if the table has active data quality issues. Also returns the names of data quality checks that did not pass most recently. This operation verifies only the status of the most recently executed data quality checks. Previous data quality issues are not counted.

parameters.name: months
parameters.description: Optional filter - the number of months to review the data quality check results. For partitioned checks, it is the number of months to analyze. The default value is 1 (which is the current month and 1 previous month).

parameters.name: checkType
parameters.description: Optional check type filter (profiling, monitoring, partitioned).

parameters.name: checkTimeScale
parameters.description: Optional time scale filter for monitoring and partitioned checks (values: daily or monthly).

200.description: The most recent data quality status of the requested table

get.description: Returns all effective DQOps configuration settings.
Returns a list of recent data quality incidents.

parameters.name: months
parameters.description: Number of recent months to load, the default is 3 months

parameters.name: open
parameters.description: Returns open incidents, when the parameter is missing, the default value is true

parameters.name: acknowledged
parameters.description: Returns acknowledged incidents, when the parameter is missing, the default value is true

parameters.name: resolved
parameters.description: Returns resolved incidents, when the parameter is missing, the default value is false

parameters.name: muted
parameters.description: Returns muted incidents, when the parameter is missing, the default value is false

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number, the first page is 1

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Page size, the default is 50 rows

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: Optional full text search filter that supports *prefix, suffix* and nest*ed filter expressions

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: Optional sort order, the default sort order is by the number of failed data quality checks

parameters.name: direction
parameters.description: Optional sort direction, the default sort direction is ascending

get.description: Return a single data quality incident's details.

parameters.name: year
parameters.description: Year when the incident was first seen

parameters.name: month
parameters.description: Month when the incident was first seen

get.description: Generates histograms of data quality issues for each day, returning the number of data quality issues on that day. The other histograms are by a column name and by a check name.

parameters.name: year
parameters.description: Year when the incident was first seen

parameters.name: month
parameters.description: Month when the incident was first seen

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: Optional full text search filter that supports *prefix, suffix* and nest*ed filter expressions

parameters.name: days
parameters.description: Optional filter for a number of recent days to read the related issues

get.description: Return a paged list of failed data quality check results that are related to an incident.

parameters.name: year
parameters.description: Year when the incident was first seen

parameters.name: month
parameters.description: Month when the incident was first seen

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number, the first page is 1

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Page size, the default is 50 rows

parameters.name: days
parameters.description: Optional filter for a number of recent days to read the related issues

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: Optional filter to return data quality issues only for a given date. The date should be an ISO8601 formatted date, it is treated as the timezone of the DQOps server.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: Optional sort order, the default sort order is by the execution date

parameters.name: direction
parameters.description: Optional sort direction, the default sort direction is ascending

Checks if the DQOps instance is healthy and operational. Returns a text "OK" and a HTTP status code 200 when the service is active and can accept jobs,  or returns a text "UNAVAILABLE" and a HTTP status code 503 when the service is still starting or is shutting down.

503.description: DQOps instance is not healthy or is still starting

post.description: Starts a new background job that will run selected data statistics collectors on a whole table

parameters.name: wait
parameters.description: Wait until the statistic collection job finishes to run, the default value is false (queue a background job and return the job id)

parameters.name: waitTimeout
parameters.description: The wait timeout in seconds, when the wait timeout elapses and the job is still running, only the job id is returned without the results. The default timeout is 120 seconds, but could be reconfigured (see the 'dqo' cli command documentation).

201.description: New job that will run data statistics collection was added to the queue

post.description: Starts a new background job that will run selected data statistics collectors on tables, calculating separate metric for each data grouping

parameters.name: wait
parameters.description: Wait until the statistic collection job finishes to run, the default value is false (queue a background job and return the job id)

parameters.name: waitTimeout
parameters.description: The wait timeout in seconds, when the wait timeout elapses and the job is still running, only the job id is returned without the results. The default timeout is 120 seconds, but could be reconfigured (see the 'dqo' cli command documentation).

201.description: New job that will run data statistics collection was added to the queue

post.description: Starts a new background job that will delete stored data about check results, sensor readouts etc.

parameters.name: waitTimeout
parameters.description: The wait timeout in seconds, when the wait timeout elapses and the delete stored data job is still running, only the job id is returned without the results. The default timeout is 120 seconds, but could be reconfigured (see the 'dqo' cli command documentation).

201.description: New job that will delete stored registry data was added to the queue

post.description: Starts a new background job that will import selected tables.

parameters.name: wait

parameters.name: waitTimeout
parameters.description: The wait timeout in seconds, when the wait timeout elapses and the import tables job is still running, only the job id is returned without the results. The default timeout is 120 seconds, but could be reconfigured (see the 'dqo' cli command documentation).

201.description: New job that will import selected tables was added to the queue

get.description: Retrieves an incremental list of job changes (new jobs or job status changes)

parameters.name: sequenceNumber
parameters.description: Change sequence number to get job changes after that sequence

200.description: A list of all queued and finished jobs returned. Call jobchangessince/{sequenceNumber} to receive incremental changes.

get.description: Retrieves a list of all queued and recently finished jobs.

200.description: A list of all queued and finished jobs returned. Call jobchangessince/{changeSequence} to receive incremental changes.

get.description: Retrieves the current status of a single job, identified by a job id.

200.description: Retrieves the current status of a single job, identified by a job id.

404.description: The job was not found or it has finished and was already been removed from the job history store.

204.description: Job was cancelled

get.description: Waits for a job to finish. Returns the status of a finished job or a current state of a job that is still running, but the wait timeout elapsed.

parameters.name: waitTimeout
parameters.description: The wait timeout in seconds, when the wait timeout elapses and the job is still running, the method returns the job model that is not yet finished and has no results. The default timeout is 120 seconds, but could be reconfigured (see the 'dqo' cli command documentation).

200.description: The job status was returned. If the response is returned before the wait timeout, the response will contain information about a finished job. When the wait timeout has elapsed, the job status could be still queued or running.

404.description: The job was not found or it has finished and was already been removed from the job history store.

post.description: Starts a new background job that will run selected data quality checks

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Data quality check run configuration (target checks and an optional time range)

parameters.name: wait
parameters.description: Wait until the checks finish to run, the default value is false (queue a background job and return the job id)

parameters.name: waitTimeout
parameters.description: The wait timeout in seconds, when the wait timeout elapses and the checks are still running, only the job id is returned without the results. The default timeout is 120 seconds, but could be reconfigured (see the 'dqo' cli command documentation).

201.description: New job that will run data quality checks was added to the queue

get.description: Waits for a job to finish. Returns the status of a finished job or a current state of a job that is still running, but the wait timeout elapsed.

parameters.name: waitTimeout
parameters.description: The wait timeout in seconds, when the wait timeout elapses and the job is still running, the method returns the job model that is not yet finished and has no results. The default timeout is 120 seconds, but could be reconfigured (see the 'dqo' cli command documentation).

200.description: Run checks job information returned. When the wait timeout has elapsed, the job status could be still queued or running and the result will be missing.

404.description: The job was not found or it has finished and was already been removed from the job history store.

parameters.description: Selection of folders that should be synchronized to the DQOps Cloud

parameters.name: wait

parameters.description: The wait timeout in seconds, when the wait timeout elapses and the synchronization with the DQOps Cloud is still running, only the job id is returned without the results. The default timeout is 120 seconds, but could be reconfigured (see the 'dqo' cli command documentation).

authorization_bearer_api_key.description: API Key passed as "Bearer <api_key>". Two types of API Keys are supported. The first type is an API Key issued by DQOps Cloud for single user instances. The second type is a locally issued API Key that is signed by this DQOps instance. Issue the API Key from the user's profile screen.
authorization_bearer_api_key.name: Authorization

check_search_filters.description: Filters addressing basic tree search parameters. These filters takes precedence over other selectors.

check_model_patch.description: Sample configured check model which will pasted onto selected checks.

selected_tables_to_columns.description: List of concrete table and column names which will be the target. Column mappings are ignored for table level checks. This filter is applied at the end.

override_conflicts.description: Override existing configurations if they're present. If false, apply updates only to the fields for which no configuration exists.

AllChecksPatchParameters.description: Parameter object for creating pruned patch trees of all checks that fit the filters.

anomaly_percent.description: Probability that the current sensor readout will achieve values within the mean according to the distribution of the previous values gathered within the time window. In other words, the inter-quantile range around the mean of the estimated normal distribution. Set the time window at the threshold level for all severity levels (warning, error, fatal) at once. The default is a time window of 30 periods (days, etc.), but at least 10 readouts must exist to run the calculation.

Probability that the current sensor readout will achieve values within the mean according to the distribution of the previous values gathered within the time window. In other words, the inter-quantile range around the mean of the estimated normal distribution. Set the time window at the threshold level for all severity levels (warning, error, fatal) at once. The default is a time window of 30 periods (days, etc.), but at least 10 readouts must exist to run the calculation.

Probability that the current sensor readout will achieve values within the mean according to the distribution of the previous values gathered within the time window. In other words, the inter-quantile range around the mean of the estimated normal distribution. Set the time window at the threshold level for all severity levels (warning, error, fatal) at once. The default is a time window of 30 periods (days, etc.), but at least 10 readouts must exist to run the calculation.

Probability that the current sensor readout will achieve values within the mean according to the distribution of the previous values gathered within the time window. In other words, the inter-quantile range around the mean of the estimated normal distribution. Set the time window at the threshold level for all severity levels (warning, error, fatal) at once. The default is a time window of 90 periods (days, etc.), but at least 30 readouts must exist to run the calculation. You can change the default value by modifying prediction_time_window parameterin Definitions section.

Probability that the current sensor readout will achieve values within the mean according to the distribution of the previous values gathered within the time window. In other words, the inter-quantile range around the mean of the estimated normal distribution. Set the time window at the threshold level for all severity levels (warning, error, fatal) at once. The default is a time window of 90 periods (days, etc.), but at least 30 readouts must exist to run the calculation. You can change the default value by modifying prediction_time_window parameterin Definitions section.

Probability that the current sensor readout will achieve values within the mean according to the distribution of the previous values gathered within the time window. In other words, the inter-quantile range around the mean of the estimated normal distribution. Set the time window at the threshold level for all severity levels (warning, error, fatal) at once. The default is a time window of 90 periods (days, etc.), but at least 30 readouts must exist to run the calculation. You can change the default value by modifying prediction_time_window parameterin Definitions section.

Probability that the current sensor readout will achieve values within the mean according to the distribution of the previous values gathered within the time window. In other words, the inter-quantile range around the mean of the estimated normal distribution. Set the time window at the threshold level for all severity levels (warning, error, fatal) at once. The default is a 30 time periods (days, etc.) time window, but at least 10 readouts must exist to run the calculation.

Probability that the current sensor readout will achieve values within the mean according to the distribution of the previous values gathered within the time window. In other words, the inter-quantile range around the mean of the estimated normal distribution. Set the time window at the threshold level for all severity levels (warning, error, fatal) at once. The default is a 30 time periods (days, etc.) time window, but at least 10 readouts must exist to run the calculation.

Probability that the current sensor readout will achieve values within the mean according to the distribution of the previous values gathered within the time window. In other words, the inter-quantile range around the mean of the estimated normal distribution. Set the time window at the threshold level for all severity levels (warning, error, fatal) at once. The default is a 30 time periods (days, etc.) time window, but at least 10 readouts must exist to run the calculation.

Probability that the current sensor readout will achieve values within the mean according to the distribution of the previous values gathered within the time window. In other words, the inter-quantile range around the mean of the estimated normal distribution. Set the time window at the threshold level for all severity levels (warning, error, fatal) at once. The default is a time window of 90 periods (days, etc.), but at least 30 readouts must exist to run the calculation. You can change the default value by modifying prediction_time_window parameterin Definitions section.

Probability that the current sensor readout will achieve values within the mean according to the distribution of the previous values gathered within the time window. In other words, the inter-quantile range around the mean of the estimated normal distribution. Set the time window at the threshold level for all severity levels (warning, error, fatal) at once. The default is a time window of 90 periods (days, etc.), but at least 30 readouts must exist to run the calculation. You can change the default value by modifying prediction_time_window parameterin Definitions section.

Probability that the current sensor readout will achieve values within the mean according to the distribution of the previous values gathered within the time window. In other words, the inter-quantile range around the mean of the estimated normal distribution. Set the time window at the threshold level for all severity levels (warning, error, fatal) at once. The default is a time window of 90 periods (days, etc.), but at least 30 readouts must exist to run the calculation. You can change the default value by modifying prediction_time_window parameterin Definitions section.

rule.description: Threshold (alerting) rules defined for a check.

supports_grouping.description: The data quality check supports a custom data grouping configuration.

data_grouping_override.description: Data grouping configuration for this check. When a data grouping configuration is assigned at a check level, it overrides the data grouping configuration from the table level. Data grouping is configured in two cases: (1) the data in the table should be analyzed with a GROUP BY condition, to analyze different groups of rows using separate time series, for example a table contains data from multiple countries and there is a 'country' column used for partitioning. (2) a static data grouping configuration is assigned to a table, when the data is partitioned at a table level (similar tables store the same information, but for different countries, etc.).

effective_schedule.description: Model of configured schedule enabled on the check level.

schedule_enabled_status.description: State of the scheduling override for this check.

comments.description: Comments for change tracking. Please put comments in this collection because YAML comments may be removed when the YAML file is modified by the tool (serialization and deserialization will remove non tracked comments).

disabled.description: Disables the data quality check. Only enabled checks are executed. The sensor should be disabled if it should not work, but the configuration of the sensor and rules should be preserved in the configuration.

exclude_from_kpi.description: Data quality check results (alerts) are included in the data quality KPI calculation by default. Set this field to true in order to exclude this data quality check from the data quality KPI calculation.

include_in_sla.description: Marks the data quality check as part of a data quality SLA. The data quality SLA is a set of critical data quality checks that must always pass and are considered as a data contract for the dataset.

configured.description: True if the data quality check is configured (not null). When saving the data quality check configuration, set the flag to true for storing the check.

filter.description: SQL WHERE clause added to the sensor query. Both the table level filter and a sensor query filter are added, separated by an AND operator.

data_clean_job_template.description: Configured parameters for the "data clean" job that after being supplied with a time range should be pushed to the job queue in order to remove stored results connected with this check.

comparisonName.description: Optional table comparison name for table comparison checks only.

timePeriods.description: List of time periods for the results, returned as a local time, sorted from the newest to the oldest.

timePeriodsUtc.description: List of time periods for the results, returned as absolute UTC time.

executedAtTimestamps.description: List of absolute timestamp (UTC) when the check was executed or an error was raised.

timePeriodDisplayTexts.description: List of time periods, sorted descending, returned as a text with a possible time zone.

statuses.description: List of check severity levels or an error status, indexes with the severity levels match the time periods.

dataGroups.description: List of data group names. Identifies the data group with the highest severity or error result.

results.description: List of sensor results. Returns the data quality result readout for the data group with the alert of the highest severity level.

connectionName.description: The connection (data source) name. Supports search patterns in the format: 'source\*', '\*_prod', 'prefix\*suffix'.

schemaTableName.description: The schema and table name. It is provided as *<schema_name>.<table_name>*, for example *public.fact_sales*. The schema and table name accept patterns both in the schema name and table name parts. Sample patterns are: 'schema_name.tab_prefix_\*', 'schema_name.*', '*.*', 'schema_name.\*_customer', 'schema_name.tab_\*_suffix'.

enabled.description: A boolean flag to target enabled tables, columns or checks. When the value of this field is not set, the default value of this field is *true*, targeting only tables, columns and checks that are not implicitly disabled.

tags.description: An array of tags assigned to the table. All tags must be present on a table to match. The tags can use patterns:  'prefix\*', '\*suffix', 'prefix\*suffix'. The tags are assigned to the table on the data grouping screen when any of the data grouping hierarchy level is assigned a static value, which is a tag.

labels.description: An array of labels assigned to the table. All labels must be present on a table to match. The labels can use patterns:  'prefix\*', '\*suffix', 'prefix\*suffix'. The labels are assigned on the labels screen and stored in the *labels* node in the *.dqotable.yaml* file.

columnName.description: The column name. This field accepts search patterns in the format: 'fk_\*', '\*_id', 'prefix\*suffix'.

columnDataType.description: The column data type that was imported from the data source and is stored in the [columns -> column_name -> type_snapshot -> column_type](../../reference/yaml/TableYaml/#columntypesnapshotspec) field in the *.dqotable.yaml* file.

columnNullable.description: Optional filter to find only nullable (when the value is *true*) or not nullable (when the value is *false*) columns, based on the value of the [columns -> column_name -> type_snapshot -> nullable](../../reference/yaml/TableYaml/#columntypesnapshotspec) field in the *.dqotable.yaml* file.

checkTarget.description: The target type of object to run checks. Supported values are: *table* to run only table level checks or *column* to run only column level checks.

checkType.description: The target type of checks to run. Supported values are *profiling*, *monitoring* and *partitioned*.

timeScale.description: The time scale of *monitoring* or *partitioned* checks to run. Supports running only *daily* or *monthly* checks. Daily monitoring checks will replace today's value for all captured check results.

checkCategory.description: The target check category, for example: *nulls*, *volume*, *anomaly*.

tableComparisonName.description: The name of a configured table comparison. When the table comparison is provided, DQOps will only perform table comparison checks that compare data between tables.

checkName.description: The target check name to run only this named check. Uses the short check name which is the name of the deepest folder in the *checks* folder. This field supports search patterns such as: 'profiling_\*', '\*_count', 'profiling_\*_percent'.

sensorName.description: The target sensor name to run only data quality checks that are using this sensor. Uses the full sensor name which is the full folder path within the *sensors* folder. This field supports search patterns such as: 'table/volume/row_\*', '\*_count', 'table/volume/prefix_\*_suffix'.

CheckSearchFilters.description: Target data quality checks filter, identifies which checks on which tables and columns should be executed.

check_name.description: Data quality check name that is used in YAML.

help_text.description: Help text that describes the data quality check.

sensor_parameters_definitions.description: List of sensor parameter fields definitions.

rule_parameters_definitions.description: List of threshold (alerting) rule's parameters definitions (for a single rule, regardless of severity).

max_jobs_per_connection.description: The maximum number of concurrent 'run checks on table' jobs that could be run on this connection. Limits the number of concurrent jobs.

table.description: The full physical name (schema.table) of the target table.

statistics_collector_search_filters.description: Statistics collectors search filters that identify the type of statistics collector to run.

data_scope.description: The target scope of collecting statistics. Statistics could be collected on a whole table or for each data grouping separately.

dummy_sensor_execution.description: Boolean flag that enables a dummy statistics collection (sensors are executed, but the statistics results are not written to the parquet files).

collect_statistics_result.description: The summary of the statistics collection job after if finished. Returns the number of collectors analyzed, columns analyzed, statistics results captured.

result.description: Optional result object that is returned only when the wait parameter was true and the "collect statistics" job has finished. The result contains the job id that was started and optionally can also contain the result of collecting the statistics  if the operation was started with wait=true parameter to wait for the "collect statistics" job to finish.

executed_statistics_collectors.description: The total count of all executed statistics collectors.

columns_analyzed.description: The count of columns for which DQOps executed a collector and tried to read the statistics.

columns_successfully_analyzed.description: The count of columns for which DQOps managed to obtain statistics.

total_collectors_failed.description: The count of statistics collectors that failed to execute.

total_collected_results.description: The total number of results that were collected.

daily_total_min_match_percent.description: Verifies that the percentage of difference in total min of a column in a table and total min of a column of another table does not exceed the set number. Stores the most recent captured value for each day when the data quality check was evaluated.

daily_total_average_match_percent.description: Verifies that the percentage of difference in total average of a column in a table and total average of a column of another table does not exceed the set number. schedule_override.description: Run check scheduling configuration. Specifies the schedule (a cron expression) when the data quality checks are executed by the scheduler.

comments.description: Comments for change tracking. Please put comments in this collection because YAML comments may be removed when the YAML file is modified by the tool (serialization and deserialization will remove non tracked comments).

disabled.description: Disables the data quality check. Only enabled data quality checks and monitorings are executed. The check should be disabled if it should not work, but the configuration of the sensor and rules should be preserved in the configuration.

exclude_from_kpi.description: Data quality check results (alerts) are included in the data quality KPI calculation by default. Set this field to true in order to exclude this data quality check from the data quality KPI calculation.

include_in_sla.description: Marks the data quality check as part of a data quality SLA. The data quality SLA is a set of critical data quality checks that must always pass and are considered as a data contract for the dataset.

quality_dimension.description: Configures a custom data quality dimension name that is different than the built-in dimensions (Timeliness, Validity, etc.).

display_name.description: Data quality check display name that could be assigned to the check, otherwise the check_display_name stored in the parquet result files is the check_name.

data_grouping.description: Data grouping configuration name that should be applied to this data quality check. The data grouping is used to group the check's result by a GROUP BY clause in SQL, evaluating the data quality check for each group of rows. Use the name of one of data grouping configurations defined on the parent table.

warning.description: Alerting threshold that raises a data quality warning that is considered as a passed data quality check

error.description: Default alerting threshold for a maximum percentage of difference of average of a table column and of a average of another table column that raises a data quality error (alert).

fatal.description: Alerting threshold that raises a fatal data quality issue which indicates a serious data quality problem

filter.description: SQL WHERE clause added to the sensor query. Both the table level filter and a sensor query filter are added, separated by an AND operator.

referenced_table.description: This field can be used to define the name of the table to be compared to. In order to define the name of the table, user should write correct name as a String.

referenced_column.description: This field can be used to define the name of the column to be compared to. In order to define the name of the column, user should write correct name as a String.

referenced_column.description: This field can be used to define the name of the column to be compared to. In order to define the name of the column, user should write correct name as a String.

schedule_override.description: Run check scheduling configuration. Specifies the schedule (a cron expression) when the data quality checks are executed by the scheduler.

comments.description: Comments for change tracking. Please put comments in this collection because YAML comments may be removed when the YAML file is modified by the tool (serialization and deserialization will remove non tracked comments).

disabled.description: Disables the data quality check. Only enabled data quality checks and monitorings are executed. The check should be disabled if it should not work, but the configuration of the sensor and rules should be preserved in the configuration.

exclude_from_kpi.description: Data quality check results (alerts) are included in the data quality KPI calculation by default. Set this field to true in order to exclude this data quality check from the data quality KPI calculation.

include_in_sla.description: Marks the data quality check as part of a data quality SLA. The data quality SLA is a set of critical data quality checks that must always pass and are considered as a data contract for the dataset.

quality_dimension.description: Configures a custom data quality dimension name that is different than the built-in dimensions (Timeliness, Validity, etc.).

display_name.description: Data quality check display name that could be assigned to the check, otherwise the check_display_name stored in the parquet result files is the check_name.

data_grouping.description: Data grouping configuration name that should be applied to this data quality check. The data grouping is used to group the check's result by a GROUP BY clause in SQL, evaluating the data quality check for each group of rows. Use the name of one of data grouping configurations defined on the parent table.

warning.description: Alerting threshold that raises a data quality warning that is considered as a passed data quality check

error.description: Default alerting threshold for a maximum percentage of difference of min of a table column and of a min of another table column that raises a data quality error (alert).

fatal.description: Alerting threshold that raises a fatal data quality issue which indicates a serious data quality problem

filter.description: SQL WHERE clause added to the sensor query. Both the table level filter and a sensor query filter are added, separated by an AND operator.

referenced_table.description: This field can be used to define the name of the table to be compared to. In order to define the name of the table, user should write correct name as a String.

referenced_column.description: This field can be used to define the name of the column to be compared to. In order to define the name of the column, user should write correct name as a String.

custom_checks.description: Dictionary of additional custom checks within this category. The keys are check names defined in the definition section. The sensor parameters and rules should match the type of the configured sensor and rule for the custom check.

daily_true_percent.description: Verifies that the percentage of true values in a column does not exceed the minimum accepted percentage. Stores the most recent captured value for each day when the data quality check was evaluated.

daily_false_percent.description: Verifies that the percentage of false values in a column does not exceed the minimum accepted percentage. Stores the most recent captured value for each day when the data quality check was evaluated.

custom_checks.description: Dictionary of additional custom checks within this category. The keys are check names defined in the definition section. The sensor parameters and rules should match the type of the configured sensor and rule for the custom check.

daily_partition_true_percent.description: Verifies that the percentage of true values in a column does not exceed the minimum accepted percentage. Creates a separate data quality check (and an alert) for each daily partition.

daily_partition_false_percent.description: Verifies that the percentage of false values in a column does not exceed the minimum accepted percentage. Creates a separate data quality check (and an alert) for each daily partition.

filter.description: SQL WHERE clause added to the sensor query. Both the table level filter and a sensor query filter are added, separated by an AND operator.

custom_checks.description: Dictionary of additional custom checks within this category. The keys are check names defined in the definition section. The sensor parameters and rules should match the type of the configured sensor and rule for the custom check.

monthly_true_percent.description: Verifies that the percentage of true values in a column does not exceed the minimum accepted percentage. Stores the most recent row count for each month when the data quality check was evaluated.

monthly_false_percent.description: Verifies that the percentage of false values in a column does not exceed the minimum accepted percentage. Stores the most recent row count for each month when the data quality check was evaluated.

custom_checks.description: Dictionary of additional custom checks within this category. The keys are check names defined in the definition section. The sensor parameters and rules should match the type of the configured sensor and rule for the custom check.

monthly_partition_true_percent.description: Verifies that the percentage of true values in a column does not exceed the minimum accepted percentage. Creates a separate data quality check (and an alert) for each monthly partition.

monthly_partition_false_percent.description: Verifies that the percentage of false values in a column does not exceed the minimum accepted percentage. Creates a separate data quality check (and an alert) for each monthly partition.

custom_checks.description: Dictionary of additional custom checks within this category. The keys are check names defined in the definition section. The sensor parameters and rules should match the type of the configured sensor and rule for the custom check.

profile_true_percent.description: Verifies that the percentage of true values in a column does not exceed the minimum accepted percentage.

profile_false_percent.description: Verifies that the percentage of false values in a column does not exceed the minimum accepted percentage.

filter.description: SQL WHERE clause added to the sensor query. Both the table level filter and a sensor query filter are added, separated by an AND operator.

schedule_override.description: Run check scheduling configuration. Specifies the schedule (a cron expression) when the data quality checks are executed by the scheduler.

comments.description: Comments for change tracking. Please put comments in this collection because YAML comments may be removed when the YAML file is modified by the tool (serialization and deserialization will remove non tracked comments).

disabled.description: Disables the data quality check. Only enabled data quality checks and monitorings are executed. The check should be disabled if it should not work, but the configuration of the sensor and rules should be preserved in the configuration.

exclude_from_kpi.description: Data quality check results (alerts) are included in the data quality KPI calculation by default. Set this field to true in order to exclude this data quality check from the data quality KPI calculation.

include_in_sla.description: Marks the data quality check as part of a data quality SLA. The data quality SLA is a set of critical data quality checks that must always pass and are considered as a data contract for the dataset.

quality_dimension.description: Configures a custom data quality dimension name that is different than the built-in dimensions (Timeliness, Validity, etc.).

display_name.description: Data quality check display name that could be assigned to the check, otherwise the check_display_name stored in the parquet result files is the check_name.

data_grouping.description: Data grouping configuration name that should be applied to this data quality check. The data grouping is used to group the check's result by a GROUP BY clause in SQL, evaluating the data quality check for each group of rows. Use the name of one of data grouping configurations defined on the parent table.

filter.description: SQL WHERE clause added to the sensor query. Both the table level filter and a sensor query filter are added, separated by an AND operator.
SQL WHERE clause added to the sensor query. Both the table level filter and a sensor query filter are added, separated by an AND operator.

custom_checks.description: Dictionary of additional custom checks within this category. The keys are check names defined in the definition section. The sensor parameters and rules should match the type of the configured sensor and rule for the custom check.

reference_column.description: The name of the reference column name in the reference table. It is the column to which the current column is compared to.

daily_sum_match.description: Verifies that percentage of the difference between the sum of values in a tested column in a parent table and the sum of a values in a column in the reference table. The difference must be below defined percentage thresholds. Stores the most recent captured value for each day when the data quality check was evaluated.

daily_min_match.description: Verifies that percentage of the difference between the minimum value in a tested column in a parent table and the minimum value in a column in the reference table. The difference must be below defined percentage thresholds. Stores the most recent captured value for each day when the data quality check was evaluated.

daily_max_match.description: Verifies that percentage of the difference between the maximum value in a tested column in a parent table and the maximum value in a column in the reference table. The difference must be below defined percentage thresholds. Stores the most recent captured value for each day when the data quality check was evaluated.

daily_mean_match.description: Verifies that percentage of the difference between the mean (average) value in a tested column in a parent table and the mean (average) value in a column in the reference table. The difference must be below defined percentage thresholds. Stores the most recent captured value for each day when the data quality check was evaluated.

daily_not_null_count_match.description: Verifies that percentage of the difference between the count of not null values in a tested column in a parent table and the count of not null values in a column in the reference table. The difference must be below defined percentage thresholds. Stores the most recent captured value for each day when the data quality check was evaluated.

daily_null_count_match.description: Verifies that percentage of the difference between the count of null values in a tested column in a parent table and the count of null values in a column in the reference table. The difference must be below defined percentage thresholds. Stores the most recent captured value for each day when the data quality check was evaluated.

custom_checks.description: Dictionary of additional custom checks within this category. The keys are check names defined in the definition section. The sensor parameters and rules should match the type of the configured sensor and rule for the custom check.

reference_column.description: The name of the reference column name in the reference table. It is the column to which the current column is compared to.

daily_partition_sum_match.description: Verifies that percentage of the difference between the sum of values in a tested column in a parent table and the sum of a values in a column in the reference table. The difference must be below defined percentage thresholds. Compares each daily partition (each day of data) between the compared table and the reference table (the source of truth).

daily_partition_min_match.description: Verifies that percentage of the difference between the minimum value in a tested column in a parent table and the minimum value in a column in the reference table. The difference must be below defined percentage thresholds. Compares each daily partition (each day of data) between the compared table and the reference table (the source of truth).

daily_partition_max_match.description: Verifies that percentage of the difference between the maximum value in a tested column in a parent table and the maximum value in a column in the reference table. The difference must be below defined percentage thresholds. Compares each daily partition (each day of data) between the compared table and the reference table (the source of truth).

daily_partition_mean_match.description: Verifies that percentage of the difference between the mean (average) value in a tested column in a parent table and the mean (average) value in a column in the reference table. The difference must be below defined percentage thresholds. Compares each daily partition (each day of data) between the compared table and the reference table (the source of truth).

daily_partition_not_null_count_match.description: Verifies that percentage of the difference between the count of not null values in a tested column in a parent table and the count of not null values in a column in the reference table. The difference must be below defined percentage thresholds. Compares each daily partition (each day of data) between the compared table and the reference table (the source of truth).

daily_partition_null_count_match.description: Verifies that percentage of the difference between the count of null values in a tested column in a parent table and the count of null values in a column in the reference table. The difference must be below defined percentage thresholds. Compares each daily partition (each day of data) between the compared table and the reference table (the source of truth).

schedule_override.description: Run check scheduling configuration. Specifies the schedule (a cron expression) when the data quality checks are executed by the scheduler.

comments.description: Comments for change tracking. Please put comments in this collection because YAML comments may be removed when the YAML file is modified by the tool (serialization and deserialization will remove non tracked comments).

disabled.description: Disables the data quality check. Only enabled data quality checks and monitorings are executed. The check should be disabled if it should not work, but the configuration of the sensor and rules should be preserved in the configuration.

exclude_from_kpi.description: Data quality check results (alerts) are included in the data quality KPI calculation by default. Set this field to true in order to exclude this data quality check from the data quality KPI calculation.

include_in_sla.description: Marks the data quality check as part of a data quality SLA. The data quality SLA is a set of critical data quality checks that must always pass and are considered as a data contract for the dataset.

quality_dimension.description: Configures a custom data quality dimension name that is different than the built-in dimensions (Timeliness, Validity, etc.).

display_name.description: Data quality check display name that could be assigned to the check, otherwise the check_display_name stored in the parquet result files is the check_name.

data_grouping.description: Data grouping configuration name that should be applied to this data quality check. The data grouping is used to group the check's result by a GROUP BY clause in SQL, evaluating the data quality check for each group of rows. Use the name of one of data grouping configurations defined on the parent table.

warning.description: Warning level threshold to raise a data quality incident with a warning severity level when the maximum values in the column in the parent table and the maximum value in the compared column (in the reference table) do not match. The alert is generated for every compared group of rows (when data grouping is enabled).

error.description: Error level threshold to raise a data quality incident with an error severity level when the maximum values in the column in the parent table and the maximum value in the compared column (in the reference table) do not match. The alert is generated for every compared group of rows (when data grouping is enabled).

fatal.description: Fatal level threshold to raise a data quality incident with a fatal severity level when the maximum values in the column in the parent table and the maximum value in the compared column (in the reference table) do not match. The alert is generated for every compared group of rows (when data grouping is enabled).

schedule_override.description: Run check scheduling configuration. Specifies the schedule (a cron expression) when the data quality checks are executed by the scheduler.

comments.description: Comments for change tracking. Please put comments in this collection because YAML comments may be removed when the YAML file is modified by the tool (serialization and deserialization will remove non tracked comments).

disabled.description: Disables the data quality check. Only enabled data quality checks and monitorings are executed. The check should be disabled if it should not work, but the configuration of the sensor and rules should be preserved in the configuration.

exclude_from_kpi.description: Data quality check results (alerts) are included in the data quality KPI calculation by default. Set this field to true in order to exclude this data quality check from the data quality KPI calculation.

include_in_sla.description: Marks the data quality check as part of a data quality SLA. The data quality SLA is a set of critical data quality checks that must always pass and are considered as a data contract for the dataset.

quality_dimension.description: Configures a custom data quality dimension name that is different than the built-in dimensions (Timeliness, Validity, etc.).

display_name.description: Data quality check display name that could be assigned to the check, otherwise the check_display_name stored in the parquet result files is the check_name.

data_grouping.description: Data grouping configuration name that should be applied to this data quality check. The data grouping is used to group the check's result by a GROUP BY clause in SQL, evaluating the data quality check for each group of rows. Use the name of one of data grouping configurations defined on the parent table.

warning.description: Warning level threshold to raise a data quality incident with a warning severity level when the mean (average) of the values in the column in the parent table and the mean (average) of values in the compared column (in the reference table) do not match. The alert is generated for every compared group of rows (when data grouping is enabled).

error.description: Error level threshold to raise a data quality incident with an error severity level when the mean (average) of the values in the column in the parent table and the mean (average) of values in the compared column (in the reference table) do not match. The alert is generated for every compared group of rows (when data grouping is enabled).

fatal.description: Fatal level threshold to raise a data quality incident with a fatal severity level when the mean (average) of the values in the column in the parent table and the mean (average) of values in the compared column (in the reference table) do not match. The alert is generated for every compared group of rows (when data grouping is enabled).

schedule_override.description: Run check scheduling configuration. Specifies the schedule (a cron expression) when the data quality checks are executed by the scheduler.

comments.description: Comments for change tracking. Please put comments in this collection because YAML comments may be removed when the YAML file is modified by the tool (serialization and deserialization will remove non tracked comments).

disabled.description: Disables the data quality check. Only enabled data quality checks and monitorings are executed. The check should be disabled if it should not work, but the configuration of the sensor and rules should be preserved in the configuration.

exclude_from_kpi.description: Data quality check results (alerts) are included in the data quality KPI calculation by default. Set this field to true in order to exclude this data quality check from the data quality KPI calculation.

include_in_sla.description: Marks the data quality check as part of a data quality SLA. The data quality SLA is a set of critical data quality checks that must always pass and are considered as a data contract for the dataset.

quality_dimension.description: Configures a custom data quality dimension name that is different than the built-in dimensions (Timeliness, Validity, etc.).

display_name.description: Data quality check display name that could be assigned to the check, otherwise the check_display_name stored in the parquet result files is the check_name.

data_grouping.description: Data grouping configuration name that should be applied to this data quality check. The data grouping is used to group the check's result by a GROUP BY clause in SQL, evaluating the data quality check for each group of rows. Use the name of one of data grouping configurations defined on the parent table.

warning.description: Warning level threshold to raise a data quality incident with a warning severity level when the minimum values in the column in the parent table and the minimum value in the compared column (in the reference table) do not match. The alert is generated for every compared group of rows (when data grouping is enabled).

error.description: Error level threshold to raise a data quality incident with an error severity level when the minimum values in the column in the parent table and the minimum value in the compared column (in the reference table) do not match. The alert is generated for every compared group of rows (when data grouping is enabled).

fatal.description: Fatal level threshold to raise a data quality incident with a fatal severity level when the minimum values in the column in the parent table and the minimum value in the compared column (in the reference table) do not match. The alert is generated for every compared group of rows (when data grouping is enabled).

compared_column_name.description: The name of the compared column in the compared table (the tested table). The REST API returns all columns defined in the metadata.

reference_column_name.description: The name of the reference column in the reference table (the source of truth). Set the name of the reference column to enable comparison between the compared and the reference columns.

compare_min.description: The column compare configuration for comparing the minimum value between the compared (tested) column and the reference column. Leave null when the measure is not compared.

compare_max.description: The column compare configuration for comparing the maximum value between the compared (tested) column and the reference column. Leave null when the measure is not compared.

compare_sum.description: The column compare configuration for comparing the sum of values between the compared (tested) column and the reference column. Leave null when the measure is not compared.

compare_mean.description: The column compare configuration for comparing the mean (average) value between the compared (tested) column and the reference column. Leave null when the measure is not compared.

compare_null_count.description: The column compare configuration for comparing the count of null values between the compared (tested) column and the reference column. Leave null when the measure is not compared.

compare_not_null_count.description: The column compare configuration for comparing the count of not null values between the compared (tested) column and the reference column. Leave null when the measure is not compared.

ColumnComparisonModel.description: The column to column comparison model used to select which measures (min, max, sum, mean, null count, not nul count) are compared for this column between the compared (tested) column and the reference column from the reference table.

custom_checks.description: Dictionary of additional custom checks within this category. The keys are check names defined in the definition section. The sensor parameters and rules should match the type of the configured sensor and rule for the custom check.

reference_column.description: The name of the reference column name in the reference table. It is the column to which the current column is compared to.

monthly_sum_match.description: Verifies that percentage of the difference between the sum of values in a tested column in a parent table and the sum of a values in a column in the reference table. The difference must be below defined percentage thresholds. Stores the most recent captured value for each month when the data quality check was evaluated.

monthly_min_match.description: Verifies that percentage of the difference between the minimum value in a tested column in a parent table and the minimum value in a column in the reference table. The difference must be below defined percentage thresholds. Stores the most recent captured value for each month when the data quality check was evaluated.

monthly_max_match.description: Verifies that percentage of the difference between the maximum value in a tested column in a parent table and the maximum value in a column in the reference table. The difference must be below defined percentage thresholds. Stores the most recent captured value for each month when the data quality check was evaluated.

monthly_mean_match.description: Verifies that percentage of the difference between the mean (average) value in a tested column in a parent table and the mean (average) value in a column in the reference table. The difference must be below defined percentage thresholds. Stores the most recent captured value for each month when the data quality check was evaluated.

monthly_not_null_count_match.description: Verifies that percentage of the difference between the count of not null values in a tested column in a parent table and the count of not null values in a column in the reference table. The difference must be below defined percentage thresholds. Stores the most recent captured value for each month when the data quality check was evaluated.

monthly_null_count_match.description: Verifies that percentage of the difference between the count of null values in a tested column in a parent table and the count of null values in a column in the reference table. The difference must be below defined percentage thresholds. Stores the most recent captured value for each month when the data quality check was evaluated.

custom_checks.description: Dictionary of additional custom checks within this category. The keys are check names defined in the definition section. The sensor parameters and rules should match the type of the configured sensor and rule for the custom check.

reference_column.description: The name of the reference column name in the reference table. It is the column to which the current column is compared to.

monthly_partition_sum_match.description: Verifies that percentage of the difference between the sum of values in a tested column in a parent table and the sum of a values in a column in the reference table. The difference must be below defined percentage thresholds. Compares each monthly partition (each month of data) between the compared table and the reference table (the source of truth).

monthly_partition_min_match.description: Verifies that percentage of the difference between the minimum value in a tested column in a parent table and the minimum value in a column in the reference table. The difference must be below defined percentage thresholds. Compares each monthly partition (each month of data) between the compared table and the reference table (the source of truth).

monthly_partition_max_match.description: Verifies that percentage of the difference between the maximum value in a tested column in a parent table and the maximum value in a column in the reference table. The difference must be below defined percentage thresholds. Compares each monthly partition (each month of data) between the compared table and the reference table (the source of truth).

monthly_partition_mean_match.description: Verifies that percentage of the difference between the mean (average) value in a tested column in a parent table and the mean (average) value in a column in the reference table. The difference must be below defined percentage thresholds. Compares each monthly partition (each month of data) between the compared table and the reference table (the source of truth).

monthly_partition_not_null_count_match.description: Verifies that percentage of the difference between the count of not null values in a tested column in a parent table and the count of not null values in a column in the reference table. The difference must be below defined percentage thresholds. Compares each monthly partition (each month of data) between the compared table and the reference table (the source of truth).

monthly_partition_null_count_match.description: Verifies that percentage of the difference between the count of null values in a tested column in a parent table and the count of null values in a column in the reference table. The difference must be below defined percentage thresholds. Compares each monthly partition (each month of data) between the compared table and the reference table (the source of truth).
