monthly_partition_valid_uuid_percent.description: Verifies that the percentage of valid UUID in a column does not fall below the minimum accepted percentage. Creates a separate data quality check (and an alert) for each monthly partition.

monthly_partition_string_invalid_ip4_add.description: Verifies that the number of invalid IP4 address in a column does not exceed the maximum accepted count. Creates a separate data quality check (and an alert) for each monthly partition.

monthly_partition_string_invalid_ip6_add.description: Verifies that the number of invalid IP6 address in a column does not exceed the maximum accepted count. Creates a separate data quality check (and an alert) for each monthly partition.

monthly_partition_string_not_match_regex.description: Verifies that the number of strings not matching the custom regex in a column does not exceed the maximum accepted count. Creates a separate data quality check (and an alert) for each monthly partition.

monthly_partition_string_match_regex_per.description: Verifies that the percentage of strings matching the custom regex in a column does not fall below the minimum accepted percentage. Creates a separate data quality check (and an alert) for each monthly partition.

monthly_partition_string_not_match_date_.description: Verifies that the number of strings not matching the date format regex in a column does not exceed the maximum accepted count. Creates a separate data quality check (and an alert) for each monthly partition.

monthly_partition_string_match_date_rege.description: Verifies that the percentage of strings matching the date format regex in a column does not fall below the minimum accepted percentage. Creates a separate data quality check (and an alert) for each monthly partition.

monthly_partition_string_match_name_rege.description: Verifies that the percentage of strings matching the name format regex in a column does not fall below the minimum accepted percentage. Creates a separate data quality check (and an alert) for each monthly partition.

monthly_partition_expected_strings_in_to.description: Verifies that the top X most popular column values contain all values from a list of expected values. Creates a separate data quality check (and an alert) for each monthly partition.

custom_checks.description: Dictionary of additional custom checks within this category. The keys are check names defined in the definition section. The sensor parameters and rules should match the type of the configured sensor and rule for the custom check.

profile_string_max_length.description: Verifies that the length of string in a column does not exceed the maximum accepted length.

profile_string_min_length.description: Verifies that the length of string in a column does not fall below the minimum accepted length.

profile_string_mean_length.description: Verifies that the length of string in a column does not exceed the mean accepted length.

profile_string_length_below_min_length_c.description: The check counts the number of strings in the column that is below the length defined by the user as a parameter.

profile_string_length_below_min_length_p.description: The check counts the percentage of strings in the column that is below the length defined by the user as a parameter.

profile_string_length_above_max_length_c.description: The check counts the number of strings in the column that is above the length defined by the user as a parameter.

profile_string_length_above_max_length_p.description: The check counts the percentage of strings in the column that is above the length defined by the user as a parameter.

profile_string_length_in_range_percent.description: The check counts the percentage of those strings with length in the range provided by the user in the column.

profile_string_empty_count.description: Verifies that empty strings in a column does not exceed the maximum accepted count.

profile_string_empty_percent.description: Verifies that the percentage of empty strings in a column does not exceed the maximum accepted percentage.

profile_string_whitespace_count.description: Verifies that the number of whitespace strings in a column does not exceed the maximum accepted count.

profile_string_whitespace_percent.description: Verifies that the percentage of whitespace strings in a column does not exceed the minimum accepted percentage.

profile_string_surrounded_by_whitespace_.description: Verifies that the number of strings surrounded by whitespace in a column does not exceed the maximum accepted count.
Verifies that the percentage of strings surrounded by whitespace in a column does not exceed the maximum accepted percentage.

profile_string_null_placeholder_count.description: Verifies that the number of null placeholders in a column does not exceed the maximum accepted count.

profile_string_null_placeholder_percent.description: Verifies that the percentage of null placeholders in a column does not exceed the maximum accepted percentage.

profile_string_boolean_placeholder_perce.description: Verifies that the percentage of boolean placeholder for strings in a column does not fall below the minimum accepted percentage.

profile_string_parsable_to_integer_perce.description: Verifies that the percentage of parsable to integer string in a column does not fall below the minimum accepted percentage.

profile_string_parsable_to_float_percent.description: Verifies that the percentage of parsable to float string in a column does not fall below the minimum accepted percentage.

profile_expected_strings_in_use_count.description: Verifies that the expected string values were found in the column. Raises a data quality issue when too many expected values were not found (were missing).

profile_string_value_in_set_percent.description: The check measures the percentage of rows whose value in a tested column is one of values from a list of expected values or the column value is null. Verifies that the percentage of rows having a valid column value does not exceed the minimum accepted percentage.

profile_string_valid_dates_percent.description: Verifies that the percentage of valid dates in a column does not fall below the minimum accepted percentage.

profile_string_valid_country_code_percen.description: Verifies that the percentage of valid country code in a column does not fall below the minimum accepted percentage.

profile_string_valid_currency_code_perce.description: Verifies that the percentage of valid currency code in a column does not fall below the minimum accepted percentage.

profile_string_invalid_email_count.description: Verifies that the number of invalid emails in a column does not exceed the maximum accepted count.

profile_string_invalid_uuid_count.description: Verifies that the number of invalid UUID in a column does not exceed the maximum accepted count.

profile_string_valid_uuid_percent.description: Verifies that the percentage of valid UUID in a column does not fall below the minimum accepted percentage.

profile_string_invalid_ip4_address_count.description: Verifies that the number of invalid IP4 address in a column does not exceed the maximum accepted count.

profile_string_invalid_ip6_address_count.description: Verifies that the number of invalid IP6 address in a column does not exceed the maximum accepted count.

profile_string_not_match_regex_count.description: Verifies that the number of strings not matching the custom regex in a column does not exceed the maximum accepted count.

profile_string_match_regex_percent.description: Verifies that the percentage of strings matching the custom regex in a column does not fall below the minimum accepted percentage.

profile_string_not_match_date_regex_coun.description: Verifies that the number of strings not matching the date format regex in a column does not exceed the maximum accepted count.

profile_string_match_date_regex_percent.description: Verifies that the percentage of strings matching the date format regex in a column does not fall below the minimum accepted percentage.

profile_string_match_name_regex_percent.description: Verifies that the percentage of strings matching the name regex in a column does not fall below the minimum accepted percentage.

profile_expected_strings_in_top_values_c.description: Verifies that the top X most popular column values contain all values from a list of expected values.

schedule_override.description: Run check scheduling configuration. Specifies the schedule (a cron expression) when the data quality checks are executed by the scheduler.

comments.description: Comments for change tracking. Please put comments in this collection because YAML comments may be removed when the YAML file is modified by the tool (serialization and deserialization will remove non tracked comments).

disabled.description: Disables the data quality check. Only enabled data quality checks and monitorings are executed. The check should be disabled if it should not work, but the configuration of the sensor and rules should be preserved in the configuration.

exclude_from_kpi.description: Data quality check results (alerts) are included in the data quality KPI calculation by default. Set this field to true in order to exclude this data quality check from the data quality KPI calculation.

include_in_sla.description: Marks the data quality check as part of a data quality SLA. The data quality SLA is a set of critical data quality checks that must always pass and are considered as a data contract for the dataset.

quality_dimension.description: Configures a custom data quality dimension name that is different than the built-in dimensions (Timeliness, Validity, etc.).

display_name.description: Data quality check display name that could be assigned to the check, otherwise the check_display_name stored in the parquet result files is the check_name.

data_grouping.description: Data grouping configuration name that should be applied to this data quality check. The data grouping is used to group the check's result by a GROUP BY clause in SQL, evaluating the data quality check for each group of rows. Use the name of one of data grouping configurations defined on the parent table.

warning.description: Alerting threshold that raises a data quality warning that is considered as a passed data quality check

error.description: Default alerting threshold for a sum in range in a column that raises a data quality error (alert).

fatal.description: Alerting threshold that raises a fatal data quality issue which indicates a serious data quality problem

schedule_override.description: Run check scheduling configuration. Specifies the schedule (a cron expression) when the data quality checks are executed by the scheduler.

column_type.description: Column data type using the monitored database type names.

length.description: Maximum length of text and binary columns.

precision.description: Precision of a numeric (decimal) data type.

scale.description: Scale of a numeric (decimal) data type.

daily_distinct_count.description: Verifies that the number of distinct values in a column does not fall below the minimum accepted count. Stores the most recent captured value for each day when the data quality check was evaluated.

daily_distinct_percent.description: Verifies that the percentage of distinct values in a column does not fall below the minimum accepted percent. Stores the most recent captured value for each day when the data quality check was evaluated.

daily_duplicate_count.description: Verifies that the number of duplicate values in a column does not exceed the maximum accepted count. Stores the most recent captured value for each day when the data quality check was evaluated.

daily_duplicate_percent.description: Verifies that the percentage of duplicate values in a column does not exceed the maximum accepted percentage. Stores the most recent captured value for each day when the data quality check was evaluated.

profile_change_distinct_percent_since_7_.description: Verifies that the distinct percent in a monitored column has changed by a fixed rate since the last readout from last week.

profile_change_distinct_percent_since_30.description: Verifies that the distinct percent in a monitored column has changed by a fixed rate since the last readout from last month.

distinct_count.description: Configuration of the profiler that counts distinct column values.

distinct_percent.description: Configuration of the profiler that measure the percentage of distinct column values.

duplicate_count.description: Configuration of the profiler that counts duplicate column values.

duplicate_percent.description: Configuration of the profiler that measure the percentage of duplicate column values.

schedule_override.description: Run check scheduling configuration. Specifies the schedule (a cron expression) when the data quality checks are executed by the scheduler.

comments.description: Comments for change tracking. Please put comments in this collection because YAML comments may be removed when the YAML file is modified by the tool (serialization and deserialization will remove non tracked comments).

disabled.description: Disables the data quality check. Only enabled data quality checks and monitorings are executed. The check should be disabled if it should not work, but the configuration of the sensor and rules should be preserved in the configuration.

exclude_from_kpi.description: Data quality check results (alerts) are included in the data quality KPI calculation by default. Set this field to true in order to exclude this data quality check from the data quality KPI calculation.

include_in_sla.description: Marks the data quality check as part of a data quality SLA. The data quality SLA is a set of critical data quality checks that must always pass and are considered as a data contract for the dataset.

quality_dimension.description: Configures a custom data quality dimension name that is different than the built-in dimensions (Timeliness, Validity, etc.).

display_name.description: Data quality check display name that could be assigned to the check, otherwise the check_display_name stored in the parquet result files is the check_name.

data_grouping.description: Data grouping configuration name that should be applied to this data quality check. The data grouping is used to group the check's result by a GROUP BY clause in SQL, evaluating the data quality check for each group of rows. Use the name of one of data grouping configurations defined on the parent table.

warning.description: Alerting threshold that raises a data quality warning that is considered as a passed data quality check

error.description: Default alerting threshold for a set percentage of rows with valid latitude value in a column that raises a data quality alert

fatal.description: Alerting threshold that raises a fatal data quality issue which indicates a serious data quality problem

warning.description: Alerting threshold that raises a data quality warning that is considered as a passed data quality check

error.description: Default alerting threshold for set percentage of values from range in a column that raises a data quality error (alert).

fatal.description: Alerting threshold that raises a fatal data quality issue which indicates a serious data quality problem

tables_count.description: Count of tables that are have a column with this name.

CommonColumnModel.description: Common column model that describes a column name that is frequently used in tables within a connection

warning_difference_percent.description: The percentage difference between the measure value on the compared table and the reference table that raises a warning severity data quality issue when the difference is bigger.

error_difference_percent.description: The percentage difference between the measure value on the compared table and the reference table that raises an error severity data quality issue when the difference is bigger.

fatal_difference_percent.description: The percentage difference between the measure value on the compared table and the reference table that raises a fatal severity data quality issue when the difference is bigger.

CompareThresholdsModel.description: Model with the compare threshold levels for raising data quality issues at different severity levels when the difference between the compared (tested) table and the reference table (the source of truth) exceed given thresholds as a percentage of difference between the actual value and the expected value from the reference table.

executed_at.description: The timestamp when the check was executed.

valid_results.description: The number of data groups that were compared and the values matched within the accepted error margin for all check severity levels.

warnings.description: The number of data groups that were compared and the values did not match, raising a warning severity level data quality issue.

errors.description: The number of data groups that were compared and the values did not match, raising an error severity level data quality issue.

fatals.description: The number of data groups that were compared and the values did not match, raising a fatal severity level data quality issue.

execution_errors.description: The number of execution errors in the check or rule that prevented comparing the tables.

not_matching_data_groups.description: A list of not matching data grouping names.

ComparisonCheckResultModel.description: The table comparison check result model for the most recent data comparison run. Identifies the check name and the number of data groupings that passed or failed the comparison.

grouping_level.description: Grouping level of failed data quality checks for creating higher level data quality incidents. The default grouping level is by a table, a data quality dimension and a check category (i.e. a datatype data quality incident detected on a table X in the numeric checks category).

minimum_severity.description: Minimum severity level of data quality issues that are grouped into incidents. The default minimum severity level is 'warning'. Other supported severity levels are 'error' and 'fatal'.

divide_by_data_groups.description: Create separate data quality incidents for each data group, creating different incidents for different groups of rows. By default, data groups are ignored for grouping data quality issues into data quality incidents.

max_incident_length_days.description: The maximum length of a data quality incident in days. When a new data quality issue is detected after max_incident_length_days days since a similar data quality was first seen, a new data quality incident is created that will capture all following data quality issues for the next max_incident_length_days days. The default value is 60 days.

mute_for_days.description: The number of days that all similar data quality issues are muted when a a data quality incident is closed in the 'mute' status.

disabled.description: Disables data quality incident creation for failed data quality checks on the data source.

webhooks.description: Configuration of Webhook URLs for new or updated incident notifications.

connection_hash.description: Connection hash that identifies the connection using a unique hash code.

parallel_runs_limit.description: The concurrency limit for the maximum number of parallel SQL queries executed on this connection.

provider_type.description: Database provider type (required). Accepts: bigquery, snowflake.

bigquery.description: BigQuery connection parameters. Specify parameters in the bigquery section.

run_checks_job_template.description: Configured parameters for the "check run" job that should be pushed to the job queue in order to run all checks within this connection.

run_profiling_checks_job_template.description: Configured parameters for the "check run" job that should be pushed to the job queue in order to run profiling checks within this connection.

run_monitoring_checks_job_template.description: Configured parameters for the "check run" job that should be pushed to the job queue in order to run monitoring checks within this connection.

run_partition_checks_job_template.description: Configured parameters for the "check run" job that should be pushed to the job queue in order to run partition partitioned checks within this connection.

collect_statistics_job_template.description: Configured parameters for the "collect statistics" job that should be pushed to the job queue in order to run all statistics collectors within this connection.

data_clean_job_template.description: Configured parameters for the "data clean" job that after being supplied with a time range should be pushed to the job queue in order to remove stored results connected with this connection.

can_edit.description: Boolean flag that decides if the current user can update or delete the connection to the data source.

can_collect_statistics.description: Boolean flag that decides if the current user can collect statistics.

can_run_checks.description: Boolean flag that decides if the current user can run checks.

can_delete_data.description: Boolean flag that decides if the current user can delete data (results).

yaml_parsing_error.description: Optional parsing error that was captured when parsing the YAML file. This field is null when the YAML file is valid. If an error was captured, this field returns the file parsing error message and the file location.

ConnectionModel.description: Connection model for with a subset of parameters, excluding all nested objects.

bigquery.description: BigQuery connection parameters. Specify parameters in the bigquery section.

snowflake.description: Snowflake connection parameters. Specify parameters in the snowflake section or set the url (which is the Snowflake JDBC url).

postgresql.description: PostgreSQL connection parameters. Specify parameters in the postgresql section or set the url (which is the PostgreSQL JDBC url).

redshift.description: Redshift connection parameters. Specify parameters in the redshift section or set the url (which is the Redshift JDBC url).

sqlserver.description: SQL Server connection parameters. Specify parameters in the sqlserver section or set the url (which is the SQL Server JDBC url).

mysql.description: MySQL connection parameters. Specify parameters in the sqlserver section or set the url (which is the MySQL JDBC url).

oracle.description: Oracle connection parameters. Specify parameters in the postgresql section or set the url (which is the Oracle JDBC url).

parallel_jobs_limit.description: The concurrency limit for the maximum number of parallel SQL queries executed on this connection.

default_grouping_configuration.description: Default data grouping configuration for all tables. The configuration may be overridden on table, column and check level. Data groupings are configured in two cases: (1) the data in the table should be analyzed with a GROUP BY condition, to analyze different datasets using separate time series, for example a table contains data from multiple countries and there is a 'country' column used for partitioning. a static dimension is assigned to a table, when the data is partitioned at a table level (similar tables store the same information, but for different countries, etc.). (2) a static dimension is assigned to a table, when the data is partitioned at a table level (similar tables store the same information, but for different countries, etc.).

schedules.description: Configuration of the job scheduler that runs data quality checks. The scheduler configuration is divided into types of checks that have different schedules.

incident_grouping.description: Configuration of data quality incident grouping. Configures how failed data quality checks are grouped into data quality incidents.

comments.description: Comments for change tracking. Please put comments in this collection because YAML comments may be removed when the YAML file is modified by the tool (serialization and deserialization will remove non tracked comments).

labels.description: Custom labels that were assigned to the connection. Labels are used for searching for tables when filtered data quality checks are executed.

connection_hash.description: Connection hash that identifies the connection using a unique hash code.

spec.description: Full connection specification, including all nested objects (but not a list of tables).

can_edit.description: Boolean flag that decides if the current user can update or delete this object.

yaml_parsing_error.description: Optional parsing error that was captured when parsing the YAML file. This field is null when the YAML file is valid. If an error was captured, this field returns the file parsing error message and the file location.

errorMessage.description: Optional error message when the status is not "SUCCESS"

schedule_override.description: Run check scheduling configuration. Specifies the schedule (a cron expression) when the data quality checks are executed by the scheduler.

comments.description: Comments for change tracking. Please put comments in this collection because YAML comments may be removed when the YAML file is modified by the tool (serialization and deserialization will remove non tracked comments).

disabled.description: Disables the data quality check. Only enabled data quality checks and monitorings are executed. The check should be disabled if it should not work, but the configuration of the sensor and rules should be preserved in the configuration.

exclude_from_kpi.description: Data quality check results (alerts) are included in the data quality KPI calculation by default. Set this field to true in order to exclude this data quality check from the data quality KPI calculation.

include_in_sla.description: Marks the data quality check as part of a data quality SLA. The data quality SLA is a set of critical data quality checks that must always pass and are considered as a data contract for the dataset.

quality_dimension.description: Configures a custom data quality dimension name that is different than the built-in dimensions (Timeliness, Validity, etc.).

display_name.description: Data quality check display name that could be assigned to the check, otherwise the check_display_name stored in the parquet result files is the check_name.

data_grouping.description: Data grouping configuration name that should be applied to this data quality check. The data grouping is used to group the check's result by a GROUP BY clause in SQL, evaluating the data quality check for each group of rows. Use the name of one of data grouping configurations defined on the parent table.

sensor_name.description: Optional custom sensor name. It is a folder name inside the user's home 'sensors' folder or the DQOps Home (DQOps distribution) home/sensors folder. Sample sensor name: table/volume/row_count. When this value is set, it overrides the default sensor definition defined for the named check definition.

rule_name.description: Optional custom rule name. It is a path to a custom rule python module that starts at the user's home 'rules' folder. The path should not end with the .py file extension. Sample rule: myrules/my_custom_rule. When this value is set, it overrides the default rule definition defined for the named check definition.

warning.description: Alerting threshold that raises a data quality warning that is considered as a passed data quality check

error.description: Default alerting threshold for a row count that raises a data quality error (alert)

fatal.description: Alerting threshold that raises a fatal data quality issue which indicates a serious data quality problem

filter.description: SQL WHERE clause added to the sensor query. Both the table level filter and a sensor query filter are added, separated by an AND operator.

disable_thumbnail.description: Disables showing a thumbnail. A thumbnail url for Looker Studio dashboards is generated by adding /thumbnail to the end of the dashboard's url. It is a Google generated thumbnail of the dashboard.

parameters.description: Key/value dictionary of additional parameters to be passed to the dashboard

dashboards.description: List of data quality dashboard at this level.

folders.description: List of data quality dashboard folders at this level.

rowsAffectedCount.description: The number of rows that were deleted from the partition.

partitionDeleted.description: True if a whole partition (a parquet file) was deleted instead of removing only selected rows.

default_data_grouping_configuration.description: True when this is the default data grouping configuration for the table.

can_edit.description: Boolean flag that decides if the current user can update or delete this object.

DataGroupingConfigurationListModel.description: Data grouping configurations list model not containing nested objects, but only the name of the grouping configuration.

can_edit.description: Boolean flag that decides if the current user can update or delete this object.

yaml_parsing_error.description: Optional parsing error that was captured when parsing the YAML file. This field is null when the YAML file is valid. If an error was captured, this field returns the file parsing error message and the file location.

DataGroupingConfigurationModel.description: Data grouping configuration model containing nested objects and the configuration of grouping dimensions.

can_edit.description: Boolean flag that decides if the current user can update or delete this object.

yaml_parsing_error.description: Optional parsing error that was captured when parsing the YAML file. This field is null when the YAML file is valid. If an error was captured, this field returns the file parsing error message and the file location.

DataGroupingConfigurationTrimmedModel.description: Data grouping configuration model with trimmed path

source.description: The source of the data grouping dimension value. The default grouping dimension source is a tag. Assign a tag when there are multiple similar tables that store the same data for different areas (countries, etc.). This could be a country name if a table or partition stores information for that country.

tag.description: The value assigned to a data quality grouping dimension when the source is 'tag'. Assign a hardcoded (static) data grouping dimension value (tag) when there are multiple similar tables that store the same data for different areas (countries, etc.). This could be a country name if a table or partition stores information for that country.

column.description: Column name that contains a dynamic data grouping dimension value (for dynamic data-driven data groupings). Sensor queries will be extended with a GROUP BY {data group level colum name}, sensors (and alerts) will be calculated for each unique value of the specified column. Also a separate time series will be tracked for each value.

expected_datatype.description: Expected data type code, the data type codes are: 1 - integers, 2 - floats, 3 - dates, 4 - timestamps, 5 - booleans, 6 - strings, 7 - mixed data types.

profiling.description: Schedule for running profiling data quality checks.

monitoring_daily.description: Schedule for running daily monitoring checks.

monitoring_monthly.description: Schedule for running monthly monitoring checks.

partitioned_daily.description: Schedule for running daily partitioned checks.

partitioned_monthly.description: Schedule for running monthly partitioned checks.

schemaTableName.description: The schema and table name. It is provided as *<schema_name>.<table_name>*, for example *public.fact_sales*. This filter does not support patterns.

dateStart.description: The start date (inclusive) to delete the data, based on the *time_period* column in Parquet files.

dateEnd.description: The end date (inclusive) to delete the data, based on the *time_period* column in Parquet files.

deleteErrors.description: Delete the data from the [errors](../../reference/parquetfiles/errors/errors.md) table. Because the default value is *false*, this parameter must be set to *true* to delete the errors.

deleteStatistics.description: Delete the data from the [statistics](../../reference/parquetfiles/statistics/statistics.md) table. Because the default value is *false*, this parameter must be set to *true* to delete the statistics.

deleteCheckResults.description: Delete the data from the [check_results](../../reference/parquetfiles/check_results/check_results.md) table. Because the default value is *false*, this parameter must be set to *true* to delete the check results.

deleteSensorReadouts.description: Delete the data from the [sensor_readouts](../../reference/parquetfiles/sensor_readouts/sensor_readouts.md) table. Because the default value is *false*, this parameter must be set to *true* to delete the sensor readouts.

columnNames.description: The list of column names to delete the data for column level results or errors only for selected columns.

checkCategory.description: The check category name, for example *volume* or *anomaly*.

tableComparisonName.description: The name of a table comparison configuration. Deletes only table comparison results (and errors) for a given comparison.

checkName.description: The name of a data quality check. Uses the short check name, for example *daily_row_count*.

checkType.description: The type of checks whose results and errors should be deleted. For example, use *monitoring* to delete only monitoring checks data.

sensorName.description: The full sensor name whose results, checks based on the sensor, statistics and errors generated by the sensor sound be deleted. Uses a full sensor name, for example: *table/volume/row_count*.

dataGroupTag.description: The names of data groups in any of the *grouping_level_1*...*grouping_level_9* columns in the Parquet tables. Enables deleting data tagged for one data source or a subset of results when the group level is captured from a column in a monitored table.

qualityDimension.description: The data quality dimension name, for example *Timeliness* or *Completeness*.

timeGradient.description: The time gradient (time scale) of the sensor and check results that are captured.

collectorCategory.description: The statistics collector category when statistics should be deleted. A statistics category is a group of statistics, for example *sampling* for the column value samples.

collectorName.description: The statistics collector name when only statistics are deleted for a selected collector, for example *sample_values*.

collectorTarget.description: The type of the target object for which the basic statistics are deleted. Supported values are *table* and *column*.

jobId.description: Job id that identifies a job that was started on the DQOps job queue.

result.description: Optional result object that is returned only when the wait parameter was true and the "delete stored data" job has finished. Contains a list of partitions that were deleted or updated.

DeleteStoredDataQueueJobResult.description: Object returned from the operation that queues a "delete stored data" job. The result contains the job id that was started and optionally can also contain a dictionary of partitions that were cleared or deleted if the operation was started with wait=true parameter to wait for the "delete stored data" job to finish.

partitionResults.description: Dictionary of partitions that where deleted or updated when the rows were deleted.

email.description: User's email that identifies the user.

DqoCloudUserModel.description: DQOps Cloud user model - identifies a user in a multi-user DQOps deployment.

parentJobId.description: Parent job id. Filled only for nested jobs, for example a sub-job that runs data quality checks on a single table.

createdAt.description: The timestamp when the job was created.

DqoQueueJobId.description: Identifies a single job that was pushed to the job queue.

properties.description: Dictionary of all effective DQOps system properties, retrieved from the default configuration files, user configuration files, environment variables and 'dqo' command arguments.

trial_period_expires_at.description: The date and time when the trial period of a PERSONAL DQOps license expires and the account is downgraded to a FREE license.

connections_limit.description: Limit of the number of connections that could be synchronized to the DQOps Cloud data quality warehouse.

users_limit.description: Limit of the number of users that could be added to a DQOps environment.

months_limit.description: Limit of the number of recent months (excluding the current month) that could be synchronized to the DQOps Cloud data quality warehouse.

connection_tables_limit.description: Limit of the number of tables inside each connection that could be synchronized to the DQOps Cloud data quality warehouse.

tables_limit.description: Limit of the total number of tables that could be synchronized to the DQOps Cloud data quality warehouse.

jobs_limit.description: Limit of the number of supported concurrent jobs that DQOps can run in parallel on this instance.

account_role.description: User role that limits possible operations that the current user can perform.

can_manage_account.description: User is the administrator of the account and can perform security related actions, such as managing users.

can_view_any_object.description: User can view any object and view all results.

can_manage_scheduler.description: User can start and stop the job scheduler.

can_run_checks.description: User can run data quality checks.

can_delete_data.description: User can delete data quality results.

can_manage_data_sources.description: User can manage data sources: create connections, import tables, change the configuration of connections, tables, columns. Change any settings in the Data Sources section.

can_synchronize.description: User can trigger the synchronization with DQOps Cloud.

can_edit_comments.description: User can edit comments on connections, tables, columns.

can_edit_labels.description: User can edit labels on connections, tables, columns.

can_manage_definitions.description: User can manage definitions of sensors, rules, checks and the default data quality check configuration that is applied on imported tables.

can_compare_tables.description: User can define table comparison configurations and compare tables.

can_manage_users.description: User can manage other users, add users to a multi-user account, change access rights, reset passwords.

can_manage_and_view_shared_credentials.description: User can manage shared credentials and view (or download) already defined shared credentials.

DqoUserProfileModel.description: The model that describes the current user and his access rights.

schedule_group.description: Field value for a schedule group to which this schedule belongs.

schedule_level.description: Field value for the level at which the schedule has been configured.

cron_expression.description: Field value for a CRON expression defining the scheduling.

time_of_execution.description: Field value for the time at which the scheduled checks will be executed.

time_until_execution.description: Field value for the time left until the execution of scheduled checks.

disabled.description: Field value stating if the schedule has been explicitly disabled.

EffectiveScheduleModel.description: Model of a configured schedule (enabled on connection or table) or schedule override (on check). Describes the CRON expression and the time of the upcoming execution, as well as the duration until this time.

expected_value.description: Expected value for the actual_value returned by the sensor. It must be an integer value.
Expected value for the actual_value returned by the sensor. It must be an integer value.

window_location.description: window.location value at the time when the log entry was reported.

message.description: Log message that should be logged.

definition.description: Field name that matches the field name (snake_case) used in the YAML specification.

optional.description: Field value is optional and may be null, when false - the field is required and must be filled.

string_value.description: Field value for a string field.

boolean_value.description: Field value for a boolean field.

integer_value.description: Field value for an integer (32-bit) field.

long_value.description: Field value for a long (64-bit) field.

double_value.description: Field value for a double field.

datetime_value.description: Field value for a date time field.

column_name_value.description: Field value for a column name field.

enum_value.description: Field value for an enum (choice) field.

string_list_value.description: Field value for an array (list) of strings.

integer_list_value.description: Field value for an array (list) of integers, using 64 bit integers.

FieldModel.description: Model of a single field that is used to edit a parameter value for a sensor or a rule. Describes the type of the field and the current value.

jobId.description: Job id that identifies a job that was started on the DQOps job queue.

result.description: Optional result object that is returned only when the wait parameter was true and the "import tables" job has finished. Contains the summary result of importing tables, including table and column schemas of imported tables.

ImportTablesQueueJobResult.description: Object returned from the operation that queues a "import tables" job. The result contains the job id that was started and optionally can also contain the result of importing the tables if the operation was started with wait=true parameter to wait for the "import tables" job to finish.

source_table_specs.description: Table schemas (including column schemas) of imported tables.

ImportTablesResult.description: Result object returned from the "import tables" job. Contains the original table schemas and column schemas of imported tables.

warnings.description: The number of failed data quality checks that generated a warning severity data quality issue.

errors.description: The number of failed data quality checks that generated an error severity data quality issue.

fatals.description: The number of failed data quality checks that generated a fatal severity data quality issue.

totalCount.description: The total count of failed data quality checks on this day.

days.description: A map of the numbers of data quality issues per day, the day uses the DQOps server timezone.

columns.description: A map of column names with the most data quality issues related to the incident. The map returns the count of issues as the value.

checks.description: A map of data quality check names with the most data quality issues related to the incident. The map returns the count of issues as the value.

incidentId.description: Incident ID - the primary key that identifies each data quality incident.

connection.description: Connection name affected by a data quality incident.

year.description: The year when the incident was first seen. This value is required to load an incident's monthly partition.

month.description: The month when the incident was first seen. This value is required to load an incident's monthly partition.

schema.description: Schema name affected by a data quality incident.

table.description: Table name affected by a data quality incident.

tablePriority.description: Table priority of the table that was affected by a data quality incident.

incidentHash.description: Data quality incident hash that identifies similar incidents on the same incident grouping level.

firstSeen.description: The UTC timestamp when the data quality incident was first seen.

lastSeen.description: The UTC timestamp when the data quality incident was last seen.

incidentUntil.description: The UTC timestamp when the data quality incident is valid until. All new failed data quality check results until that date will be included in this incident, unless the incident status is changed to resolved, so a new incident must be created.

dataGroup.description: The data group that was affected by a data quality incident.

qualityDimension.description: The data quality dimension that was affected by a data quality incident.

checkCategory.description: The data quality check category that was affected by a data quality incident.

checkType.description: The data quality check type that was affected by a data quality incident.

checkName.description: The data quality check name that was affected by a data quality incident.

highestSeverity.description: The highest failed check severity that was detected as part of this data quality incident. Possible values are: 1 - warning, 2 - error, 3 - fatal.

minimumSeverity.description: The minimum severity of the data quality incident, copied from the incident configuration at a connection or table at the time when the incident was first seen. Possible values are: 1 - warning, 2 - error, 3 - fatal.

failedChecksCount.description: The total number of failed data quality checks that were seen when the incident was raised for the first time.

issueUrl.description: The link (url) to a ticket in an external system that is tracking this incident.

incident_opened_webhook_url.description: Webhook URL where the notification messages describing new incidents are pushed using a HTTP POST request. The format of the JSON message is documented in the IncidentNotificationMessage object.

incident_acknowledged_webhook_url.description: Webhook URL where the notification messages describing acknowledged messages are pushed using a HTTP POST request. The format of the JSON message is documented in the IncidentNotificationMessage object.

incident_resolved_webhook_url.description: Webhook URL where the notification messages describing resolved messages are pushed using a HTTP POST request. The format of the JSON message is documented in the IncidentNotificationMessage object.

incident_muted_webhook_url.description: Webhook URL where the notification messages describing muted messages are pushed using a HTTP POST request. The format of the JSON message is documented in the IncidentNotificationMessage object.

openIncidents.description: Count of open (new) data quality incidents.

max_count.description: Maximum accepted value for the actual_value returned by the sensor (inclusive).
Maximum accepted value for the actual_value returned by the sensor (inclusive).

max_diff_percent.description: Maximum accepted value for the percentage of difference between expected_value and actual_value returned by the sensor (inclusive).
Maximum accepted value for the percentage of difference between expected_value and actual_value returned by the sensor (inclusive).
Maximum accepted value for the percentage of difference between expected_value and actual_value returned by the sensor (inclusive).

max_failures.description: Maximum number of consecutive days with check failures. A check is failed when a sensor query fails due to a connection error, missing or corrupted table.
Maximum number of consecutive days with check failures. A check is failed when a sensor query fails due to a connection error, missing or corrupted table.
Maximum number of consecutive days with check failures. A check is failed when a sensor query fails due to a connection error, missing or corrupted table.

max_missing.description: The maximum number of values from the expected_values list that were not found in the column (inclusive).
The maximum number of values from the expected_values list that were not found in the column (inclusive).

max_value.description: Maximum accepted value for the actual_value returned by the sensor (inclusive).
